speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M008
dialog: Being dishonest with him. I mean, that sort of thing always pays off and now it's paying off.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F010
dialog: What you mean dishonest?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M009
dialog: You know that Larry's not coming back and I know it. Why do we allow him to go on thinking that we believe with him?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F011
dialog: What do you want to do argue with him?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M010
dialog: No, I don't want to argue with him, but it's about time he realized that nobody believes Larry's alive anymore?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M011
dialog: Why shouldn't he dream of him and walk the nights waiting for him? Do we contradict him? Do we say straight out that we don't have any hope anymore? That we haven't had hope for years now?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F012
dialog: You can't say that to him.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M012
dialog: We've got to say it to him.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F013
dialog: Can you prove it? How can you prove it?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M013
dialog: For God sakes, it's been three years. Nobody comes back after three years. It's insane.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F014
dialog: To you it is and to me, but not to him. I mean, you can talk yourself blue in the face, but he--there's no body and no grave so where are you?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M014
dialog: Sit down, Mom. I want to talk to you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F015
dialog: Trouble is the God damn newspapers. Every month or so a boy turns up out of nowhere so, you know, the next one is gonna be Larry.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M015
dialog: All right. All right. Listen to me. You know why I brought Annie here don't you?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F016
dialog: Why?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M016
dialog: You know.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F017
dialog: I've got an idea, but what's the story?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M017
dialog: I'm gonna ask her to marry me.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F018
dialog: Well, that's only your business, Chris.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M018
dialog: You know it's not only my business.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F019
dialog: What do you want me to do? You're old enough to know your own mind.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M019
dialog: So it's all right then?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M020
dialog: I'll go ahead with it?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F020
dialog: Well, you want to make sure that your father isn't going to--

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M021
dialog: Well, then it isn't just my business--

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F021
dialog: I'm just saying that--

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M022
dialog: Ah, sometimes you infuriate me. You know that? I mean, isn't it your business too if I tell Dad and flips--freaks out about it? I mean, you have such a talent for ignoring things.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F022
dialog: I ignore what I gotta ignore. The girl is Larry's girl.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M023
dialog: She's not Larry's girl.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F023
dialog: From your father's point of view, he isn't dead. And you've no right to take his girl.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F024
dialog: And you can go on from there if you know where to go, but I don't know where to go. See, I don't know. Now what can I do for you?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M024
dialog: I don't know why, but, every time I reach out for something that I want, I have to pull back 'cause someone else will suffer. My whole bloody life. Time after time after time.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F025
dialog: You're a considerate fellow. There's nothing wrong with that.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M025
dialog: To hell with that.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F026
dialog: [BREATHING] Have you asked Annie yet?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M026
dialog: I wanted to get this settled first.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F027
dialog: Well, how do you know she'll marry you? Maybe she feels the same way your father does.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M027
dialog: Well, if she does, then that's the end of it. But from her letters, I think she's forgotten him. I'll find out. And then we'll thrash it out with Dad, right? Mom, don't avoid me.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F028
dialog: Trouble is, you don't see enough women.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F029
dialog: You never did.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M028
dialog: So what, I'm not fast with women.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F030
dialog: I just don't see why it has to be Annie.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M029
dialog: Because it is.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F031
dialog: Well, that's a good answer, but it doesn't answer anything. I mean, you've been away for--at war. It's been five years.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M030
dialog: I can't help it. I know her best. I mean, I grew up next door to her.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M031
dialog: These years when I think of a wife, I think of Annie. What do you want, a diagram?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F032
dialog: I don't want a diagram. Umm-- He thinks he's coming back, Chris. You marry that girl and you're pronouncing him dead.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F033
dialog: I mean, what's gonna happen to your father? Do you know? I don't.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M032
dialog: All right. All right, then, Mom.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F034
dialog: I just--give it some more thought.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M033
dialog: I've given it three years of thought. I thought that if I waited Dad would forget about Larry and we could have a regular wedding and everything happy.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M034
dialog: But if I can't--if that can't happen here, then I'll have to get out.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F035
dialog: What the hell is this?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M035
dialog: I'll get out. I'll get married and go live some place else. Maybe New York.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F036
dialog: Are you crazy?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M036
dialog: I've been a good son too long. A good sucker. I'm through with it.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F037
dialog: What about the business? What the hell is this?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M037
dialog: The business? The business doesn't inspire me.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F038
dialog: Must you be inspired?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M038
dialog: Yes. I like it an hour a day. If I'm gonna grub for my money all day long, at least in the evening I want it beautiful.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M039
dialog: I want a family. I want kids. I want something that I can give myself to. Annie's in the middle of that. Now, where do I find it?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F039
dialog: Tell me, you'd leave the business?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M040
dialog: Yes, on this I would.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F040
dialog: Well, you don't want to think like that.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M041
dialog: Then help me stay here.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F041
dialog: All right, but just don't go thinkin' like that 'cause otherwise what did we work for? I mean, the whole thing is for you, Chris. The whole shootin' match is for you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M042
dialog: I know. I know, Mom. Just help me stay here.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F042
dialog: All right. Just-- just don't go thinkin' that way, you hear me?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M043
dialog: I am thinkin' that way.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F043
dialog: I don't understand you, do I?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_M044
dialog: No, you don't. I'm a pretty tough guy.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_1_F044
dialog: I can see that.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F000
dialog: Why did he invite her here?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M000
dialog: Why does that bother you?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F001
dialog: She's been in New York for three and half years. Why all of a sudden?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M001
dialog: Well, maybe he just wanted to see her again.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F002
dialog: Nobody comes seven hundred miles just to see.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M002
dialog: What do you mean? He lived next door to the girl all his life. Why wouldn't he want to see her again?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M003
dialog: Don't look at me like that. He didn't tell me anymore than he told you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F003
dialog: She's not-

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M004
dialog: How do you know he's even thinking of it?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F004
dialog: -he's not gonna marry her.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F005
dialog: It's got that all about it.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M005
dialog: Well, so what?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F006
dialog: What's going on here, Joe?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M006
dialog: Now, listen Kate.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F007
dialog: She's not his girl, Joe. She knows she's not.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M007
dialog: You can't read her mind.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F008
dialog: Well then why is she still single? I mean, New York is full of men. Why isn't she married? Probably a hundred people told her she's crazy, but she's waited.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M008
dialog: How do you know why she's waited?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F009
dialog: She knows what I know, that's why. She's faithful as a rock. In my worst moments I think of her waiting and I know again that I'm right.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M009
dialog: Look, it's a nice day. What are we arguing for?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F010
dialog: Nobody in this house dares take her faith away, Joe? Strangers might, but not his father, not his brother.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M010
dialog: Well, what do you want me to do about it?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F011
dialog: I want you to act like he's coming back. Both of you. Don't you think I haven't noticed since she got here. I won't stand for any nonsense.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M011
dialog: But Kate--

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F012
dialog: Because if he's not coming back, I'll kill myself. I mean, laugh--laugh at me, but...

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F013
dialog: But why did that happen the very night she came here? She sleeps in his room and his memorial breaks to pieces. Just look. Look at it.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M012
dialog: Calm yourself.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F014
dialog: Believe with me, Joe. I can't stand all alone.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M013
dialog: Calm yourself.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F015
dialog: Last week, a man turned up in Detroit missing longer than Larry. I mean, you read it yourself.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M014
dialog: All right. All right. Calm yourself.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F016
dialog: You, above all, have to believe.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M015
dialog: What?- Why- Why me above all?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F017
dialog: Just--just don't stop believing.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M016
dialog: What does that mean? Me above all?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M017
dialog: Look at you. Look at you shaking.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_F018
dialog: I can't help it.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_2_M018
dialog: What have I got to hide? What the hell is the matter with you Kate?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F000
dialog: You're the only one I know who loves his parents.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M000
dialog: I know, it went out of style, didn't it?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F001
dialog: It's all right. It's a good thing.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F002
dialog: You know, it's lovely here, the air is sweet.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M001
dialog: You're not sorry you came?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F003
dialog: No, not sorry. Um, but, I'm- I'm not gonna stay.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M002
dialog: Why?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F004
dialog: Well, for one thing, your mother as much as told me to go.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M003
dialog: Oh.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F005
dialog: You saw that. I mean and then, well, you've been kind of, um--

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M004
dialog: What?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F006
dialog: Well, kind of embarrassed ever since I got here.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M005
dialog: The trouble is, I planned on sort of sneaking up on you over a period of a week or so. But, they take it for granted that we're all set.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F007
dialog: I knew they would, your mother anyway.

speaker: M:
dialog: you know?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F008
dialog: Well,

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F009
dialog: from her point of view, why else would I come?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M006
dialog: Oh. Would you want to? I guess you know, this is why I asked you to come.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F010
dialog: I--I guess this is why I came.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M007
dialog: Anne, I love you. I love you a great deal. I love you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M008
dialog: I have no imagination. That's all I know to tell you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M009
dialog: I'm embarrassing you and I didn't want to tell it to you here. I wanted some place we'd never been before. A place where we'd be brand new to each other.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M010
dialog: You feel it's wrong here, don't you? This yard, this chair. I want you to be ready for me. I don't want to have to win you away from anything.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F011
dialog: Oh, Chris, I've been ready for a long, long time.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M011
dialog: And he's gone forever. You're sure?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F012
dialog: I almost got married two years ago.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M012
dialog: Why didn't you?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F013
dialog: You started to write me and--

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M013
dialog: You felt something that far back?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F014
dialog: Every day since.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M014
dialog: Anne, why didn't you let me know?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F015
dialog: Well, I was waiting for you. I mean, till then you never wrote and when you did, I mean, what did you say? You can sure be ambiguous sometimes.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M015
dialog: Give me a kiss, Anne. Give me a-

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M016
dialog: oh God, I kissed you. I kissed Annie. How long--how long I've been waiting to kiss you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F016
dialog: I will never forgive you. Why did you wait all these years? All I did was sit and wonder if I was crazy for thinking of you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M017
dialog: Oh, Annie, we're gonna live now. I'm gonna make you so happy.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F017
dialog: Not like that you're not.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M018
dialog: I kissed you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F018
dialog: Like Larry's brother. Do it like you, Chris. What is it?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M019
dialog: Let's drive someplace. I want to be alone with you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F019
dialog: No. What is it, your mother?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M020
dialog: No. Nothing like that.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F020
dialog: Then, what's wrong? I mean, even in your letters there was some--something ashamed.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M021
dialog: Yeah, I suppose I have been. But it's going from me.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F021
dialog: You've gotta tell me.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M022
dialog: I don't know how to start.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F022
dialog: It wouldn't work this way.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M023
dialog: It's all mixed up with so many other things. You remember overseas, I was in command of a company?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F023
dialog: Yeah, sure.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M024
dialog: Well, I lost them.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F024
dialog: How many?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M025
dialog: Just about all.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F025
dialog: Oh, gee.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M026
dialog: It takes some time for a guy to toss that off. 'Cause they weren't just men.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M027
dialog: For instance, one time, it had been raining several days and this kid came to me and gave me his last pair of dry socks. I put them in pocket. It's only a little thing, but that's the kind of guys I had.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M028
dialog: They didn't die, they killed themselves for each other. I mean that exactly. A little more selfish and they'd have been here today.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M029
dialog: I got this idea watching them go down. Everything was being destroyed, see, but it seemed that there was one new thing being made. A sort of responsibility. Man for man.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M030
dialog: You know what I mean? To show that, to bring that onto the Earth again, like some kind of monument and everyone would feel it standing behind him and it would make a difference to him.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M031
dialog: Then I came back and it was incredible. There was no meaning in it here. The whole thing to them seemed like sort of a bus accident. I went to work with Dad and that rat race again.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M032
dialog: And I felt what you said, ashamed somehow 'cause nobody was changed at all. It seemed to make suckers out of a lot of guys. I felt wrong to be alive to open the new bank book, drive the new car, see the new refrigerator.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M033
dialog: I mean, you can take those things out of a war, but when you drive that car, you've gotta know that it came out of the love a man can have for a man. You've gotta be a little better because of it.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M034
dialog: Because otherwise all you have is really loot and there's blood on it. And I didn't want to take any of it. And I guess that included you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F026
dialog: You still feel that way?

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M035
dialog: I want you now Annie.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F027
dialog: 'Cause you mustn't feel that way. Because you have a right to everything that you have. Do you understand that? Everything, Chris, and me too.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F028
dialog: I mean, and your money, there's nothing wrong with your money. I mean, your father put hundreds of planes in the air. A man should be paid for that.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_M036
dialog: I know Annie. Annie, I'm gonna make a fortune for you.

speaker: Ses02F_script01_3_F029
dialog: What'll I do with a fortune?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M000
dialog: What time is it? They're supposed to run around midnight.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M001
dialog: This is great, isn't it? Look at the night we've got here, couldn't be better.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M002
dialog: I would have liked to have gone a little further up the coast to get away from the lights and the people, but I was afraid we'd miss it.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M003
dialog: How you doing?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F000
dialog: Fine.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M004
dialog: Is that--no--is that just foam? I can't even tell.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M005
dialog: Well, I guess we can tell, it probably isn't right? Probably be unmistakable don't you think?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M006
dialog: How you doing? Aw, you know what I forgot? I forgot to bring my flashlight. Oh, how could I be so stupid? I should've brought my flashlight.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F001
dialog: What flashlight?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M007
dialog: You know, the flashlight, the silver one. There's only one isn't there?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F002
dialog: That's not your flashlight.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M008
dialog: Who's is it?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F003
dialog: It's ours. It's mine too.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M009
dialog: Oh, well sure.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F004
dialog: You kept saying my flashlight, if as if somehow it's just yours. I mean is that supposed to make me feel?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M010
dialog: Right, of course. Our flashlight. Mine and yours. I mean, me flashlight is su flashlight naturally.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M011
dialog: How could we forget to bring it? I hope the moon stays out.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M012
dialog: I wonder, do they always run during a full moon? I can't remember if it was full last year. Do you remember?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F005
dialog: Yeah.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M013
dialog: You cold? Do you want my jacket? Oh, we should've brought the blanket. Our blanket.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M014
dialog: This is great, isn't it? A six pack would be just the ticket right now.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M015
dialog: I can't believe I forgot. I'm like a kid. It's amazing I got out of the house with my fly zipped.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M016
dialog: You think they can hear us talk? Or feel the vibrations in the sand when we move around?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F006
dialog: I'm cold.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M017
dialog: Do you want my jacket?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F007
dialog: It's after eleven, let's just go home.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M018
dialog: Are you kidding? We'd miss it. We just got here. What's the point of coming down here if we just turn around and go home.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F008
dialog: There is no point in coming down here.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M019
dialog: Right.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F009
dialog: That's my point.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M020
dialog: That's my point too.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F010
dialog: So, let's go.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M021
dialog: No. No. That's not my point. The point is there's no point in coming down if we just leave. Don't you want to see it?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F011
dialog: Not particularly.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M022
dialog: Why not?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F012
dialog: I just don't. It's stupid.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M023
dialog: Honey, this is a natural phenomenon. I mean this only happens once a year, you know.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M024
dialog: Think about the people in Kansas, they had to get plane tickets and hotel reservations to see this. We live forty minutes away. It's too good to pass up.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F013
dialog: Pass up what? These little fish swim onto the beach, they flop around, and swim away. And then they die.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M025
dialog: Yeah, but that moment on the beach, is the highlight of their little lives. All that flopping is laying eggs or what do you--spawning or mating. I mean,

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M026
dialog: this is a big night for these guys. Life's last orgy.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F014
dialog: What are you so excited about? I mean, it's not a moon landing we're talking about here. It's fish. It's a fish nobody even eats.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M027
dialog: Yeah they do.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F015
dialog: Ah, Augie.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M028
dialog: Alright. But it's fish that do something that none of the other fish do. Like the swallows returning to Capistrano or the lemmings throwing themselves off the cliffs.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M029
dialog: There's--there's a bit of the magic--some unexplainable here. I don't see how you can not be interested.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F016
dialog: I'm just not.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M030
dialog: For real?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F017
dialog: Yeah.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M031
dialog: I don't get it. The first time we came here, you said it was the best night of your life.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M032
dialog: And last year, I remember specifically you were so excited to go that you stubbed your toe rushing me out of the house and didn't even notice until we got in the car.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F018
dialog: Last year, you will also remember our shoes got wet, I got sand in my panties, you got a sore throat, we got in a big fight over nothing, and we didn't see the grunions.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M033
dialog: We weren't in a good spot.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F019
dialog: We didn't see them the first time either.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M034
dialog: We just weren't in a good spot. This is a much better spot. Believe me, I've got good instincts for these things.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M035
dialog: There is that--no that's just seaweed isn't it?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M036
dialog: Oh man, this is great, isn't it? I wouldn't miss this for anything. Here, think about this, all right, I know you're not interested, but think about this.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M037
dialog: Somewhere out there, this huge mass of silver fish swimming this way.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M038
dialog: They don't know why, we don't know why. Nobody sent them an invitation or a map, it wasn't a decision, just-

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M039
dialog: all as one, this time release instinctual little firecracker went off and they all turned and formed a line as long as the California coast and started swimming. And they're swimming right now as if that's all that matters.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M040
dialog: It's like single mindedness with no mind. It's urgency that's pure urge. They don't know what drives them. They don't ask it a question or give it a name.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M041
dialog: They just turn as one and start the swim that brings them right here to where we stand, for a massive celebration of sex and death.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M042
dialog: Ah, God, I'm giving myself goose bumps. Look, all my hairs are popped up.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F020
dialog: That's the wind.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M043
dialog: Well, so what do you think?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F021
dialog: About what?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_M044
dialog: What I was saying.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_1_F022
dialog: It's ridiculous.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M000
dialog: Well, so what do you think?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F000
dialog: About what?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M001
dialog: What I was saying.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F001
dialog: It's ridiculous.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M002
dialog: It certainly is not. It's slightly exaggerated scientific fact.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F002
dialog: It's PR. Somebody sold you a bill of goods that this wonderful event is gonna take place on the beach.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M003
dialog: Well, I'm not the only one. Look at all these people.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F003
dialog: Sure, everybody's told the same story. It keeps us all excited. It keeps us coming back for more. It keeps us thinking that life is gonna start any second now if we could just find the right spot and get in on the action.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M004
dialog: Are we talking about the same thing?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F004
dialog: Well, I'm sorry, but it's still just fish to me.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M005
dialog: Carla, can I ask you something? Don't take this wrong, but are you having your period?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F005
dialog: God damn it, Augie, don't ask me that. I hate it when you ask me that. You always ask me that. It's insulting.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M006
dialog: Well, what's bugging you?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F006
dialog: We just have different ideas of what this evening is supposed to look like.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M007
dialog: There's nothing to it. We come here, the grunion arrive, they do their little fish business, we go ooh, ah, look at the fish. They go home. We go home.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F007
dialog: For heaven sake, we're not going to see the grunions.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M008
dialog: Why not?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F008
dialog: We never do, do we? I mean, have we ever?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M009
dialog: We've missed them twice. That's not ever.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F009
dialog: Twice is every time we've tried. That's ever.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M010
dialog: Well, we'll see them this year.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F010
dialog: No, we won't. It's pointless. It's like waiting up to see Santa Claus.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F011
dialog: I mean, I feel like my whole life is gonna be spent standing on the beach with my eyes wide open and my hands clasped expectantly waiting for the fish to show up. And the fish won't show up.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M011
dialog: I thought you wanted to see it.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F012
dialog: You don't understand anything I'm saying.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M012
dialog: No, of course not.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F013
dialog: I did want to see it. I always do. I keep thinking that this is gonna be the time and it never is.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M013
dialog: It's just fish. Nothing to get traumatized about.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F014
dialog: For heaven sake, this isn't about fish.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M014
dialog: All right. Look, I've been trying to work this backwards, but I cannot seem to figure out the exact moment that we took a turn for the worst.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M015
dialog: I mean, you were- you were fine during the phone call from Marge. Dinner was okay. Doing the dishes was no problem. Let's see. I took a shower. You watched the news.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M016
dialog: You said, "Hey the grunion are running tonight." I said, "Great, let's go. I feel lucky."

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M017
dialog: Okay, so I'm putting on my jacket, putting out the animals, getting the car out of the garage--

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F015
dialog: Do you remember the first time we came to see it? It was about four years ago, right after we got married.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F016
dialog: I thought I was pregnant, you had a bottle of champagne, but no glasses. You asked me to dance, so we kicked off our shoes and you popped the cork.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F017
dialog: And while we were dancing, you said the softest, most intimate things to me right into my ear so that I could feel them as much as hear them.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F018
dialog: And I remember thinking, this is it. You know, at last--at last I am as happy as I am supposed to be.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M018
dialog: Wait a minute. I've got it.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F019
dialog: Just dancing barefoot in the sand, drinking champagne out of the bottle.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M019
dialog: It was in the car, right? Driving past the Knickerbocker Liquor Locker, you said, "let's get some champagne," and I said, "time's a wasting" or something like that, right?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M020
dialog: Yeah, of course, I see it now. You want this to be like that other time, right? That's it, right?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F020
dialog: I'd rather not remember some things. I would rather not hope for some things.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M021
dialog: Okay, yeah, sure, I see it now. Listen, you wanna dance?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F021
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M022
dialog: You want me to go get some champagne?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F022
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M023
dialog: Take off our shoes?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F023
dialog: No. No.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M024
dialog: Well, what? You want me to breathe in your ear?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F024
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M025
dialog: You wanna get married again?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F025
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M026
dialog: What? What? You want a divorce?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F026
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M027
dialog: A vacation?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F027
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M028
dialog: A new carpet? A poodle? Ice cream? Back rub? A suicide pact? What? What? Carla, what the hell do you want?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F028
dialog: I want something to turn out the way that it's supposed to.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M029
dialog: Well, welcome to the human race. Do you think this is what I had in mind when I proposed? That four years down the road, we'd be at the beach yelling at each other over fish?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M030
dialog: No. You think I knew that there'd be times when you'd look at me like a used Kleenex? Or that I'd look at you and think, holy hell, when's the next flight to Alaska?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M031
dialog: No, Carla, I'm just like you. I thought it was gonna be all peaches and roses and sand in our toes and wind in our hair and the fish will always come and the bills will pay themselves and we'll have three fat rosy kids and ha, ha, baby, the joke's on us

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M032
dialog: 'cause you know what you get, Carla? You know what you get? This.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F029
dialog: This. What? What is this? This isn't even anything.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M033
dialog: Yes, it is.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F030
dialog: Uh, right this is standing on the beach. This is waiting. This is fighting.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M034
dialog: Right.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F031
dialog: Well. This isn't anything like I thought anything would be like.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M035
dialog: I know, me neither.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F032
dialog: I mean, this is just this. It includes a lot and everything, but it isn't something else. Do you have any idea what I'm trying to say?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M036
dialog: I'm doing the best I can.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F033
dialog: I know that, Augie. Really, I do.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F034
dialog: I know that you meant this to be special and nice and the sand and the moon and all, but I just couldn't help thinking about being somewhere else.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M037
dialog: Maybe if you were with somebody else too.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F035
dialog: I didn't say that.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M038
dialog: No, I know. But still. I know I don't make you happy.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F036
dialog: Oh, for heaven sake, whatever I'm doing, I'd rather be doing it with you.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M039
dialog: Yeah?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F037
dialog: Oh, don't be ridiculous. I mean, don't you know that?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F038
dialog: You're the one who probably wishes you were with someone else. Someone who--you'd rather enjoy yourself and didn't take everything so hard.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M040
dialog: Well, now that you mention it. No, I don't.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F039
dialog: Okay. Fine so. We're in the wrong spot, but we're with the right person.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M041
dialog: I don't know. It seemed like a pretty good spot to me. I mean, look at the view you have of the moon from here.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F040
dialog: Yeah, I noticed that. Looks pretty, doesn't it? Big ol' white moon.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M042
dialog: Well, look what we have here.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F041
dialog: Augie, you brought refreshments.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M043
dialog: It's not champagne.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F042
dialog: Well, then we don't need glasses.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M044
dialog: You still cold? Do you wanna go home?

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F043
dialog: No. I think you might be right. Maybe this is the spot after all.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F044
dialog: Augie, I'm sorry.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M045
dialog: Shh. If we're very quiet the fish might come.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_F045
dialog: Or not.

speaker: Ses02F_script02_2_M046
dialog: Or not.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M000
dialog: Good God.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F000
dialog: Do you think it's them?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M001
dialog: I wonder.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F001
dialog: Well, nobody know we're here except Freda and she wouldn't ring up.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M002
dialog: Must be them, then.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F002
dialog: What're we gonna do?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M003
dialog: We're all right, darling, aren't we? Whatever happens.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F003
dialog: Now and always, sweet.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M004
dialog: I don't care then.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F004
dialog: It was bound to come sooner or later.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M005
dialog: Hello? Hello? What? Wrong number.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F005
dialog: Ah, it send shivers up my spine.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M006
dialog: What do we do if they suddenly walk in on us?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F006
dialog: Behave exquisitely.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M007
dialog: With the most perfect poise?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F007
dialog: Oh, of course. I shall probably do a court curtsy.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M008
dialog: Things that ought to matter dreadfully don't matter at all when one's happy. Do they?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F008
dialog: What's so horrible is that one can't stay happy.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M009
dialog: Oh, darling, don't say that.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F009
dialog: It's true. The whole business is a very poor joke.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M010
dialog: Meaning that sacred and beautiful thing, love?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F010
dialog: Yes, meaning just that.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M011
dialog: Oh, what does it all mean? That's what I ask myself in my ceaseless quest for ultimate truth. Dear God, what does it all mean?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F011
dialog: Don't laugh at me. I'm serious.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M012
dialog: You mustn't be serious, my dear one. That's just what they want.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F012
dialog: Who's they?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M013
dialog: All those futile moralists that try to make life unbearable. Laugh at them. Be flippant. Laugh at everything. All their sacred shibboleths.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M014
dialog: Flippancy brings out the acid in their damn sweetness and light.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F013
dialog: If I laugh at everything, then I must laugh at us too.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M015
dialog: Certainly, you must. We're figures of fun, alright.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F014
dialog: Well how long will it last us, this ludicrous overbearing love of ours.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M016
dialog: Who knows.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F015
dialog: Well, shall we always want to bicker and fight?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M017
dialog: No, that desire will fade. Along with our passion.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F016
dialog: Oh, dear, shall we like that?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M018
dialog: Depends on how well we've played.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F017
dialog: Well, what happens if one of us dies? I mean, does the one that's left still laugh?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M019
dialog: Yes. Yes. With all his might.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F018
dialog: That's serious enough, isn't it?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M020
dialog: No. No, it isn't. Death is very laughable. Such a cunning little mystery. All done with mirrors.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F019
dialog: Darling, I believe you're talking nonsense.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M021
dialog: So is everyone else in the long run.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M022
dialog: Let's be superficial and pity the poor philosophers. Let's blow our trumpets and squeakers and enjoy the party as much as we can. Like quite idiotic, very small school children. Let's savor the delight of the moment.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M023
dialog: Come and kiss me, darling, before your body rots and worms pop in and out of your eye sockets.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F020
dialog: Elliott, worms don't pop.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M024
dialog: I don't care what you do. See, you could paint yourself green and dance naked in the Place Vendome and rush off madly with all the men in the world and I shan't say a word. As long as you love me best.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F021
dialog: Oh, thank you, dear. The same applies to you except that if I catch so much as looking at another woman, I'll kill you.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M025
dialog: You remember that awful scene we had in Venice?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F022
dialog: Which particular one?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M026
dialog: The one when you bought that little painted wooden snake in the Piazza and put it on my bed.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F023
dialog: Charles. That was his name. Charles. He did wriggle so beautifully.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M027
dialog: Ah, horrible thing. I hated it.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F024
dialog: Yes, I know you did. You threw it out of the window into the Grand Canal. I don't think I'll ever forgive you for that.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M028
dialog: How long did that row last?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F025
dialog: It went in intermittently for days.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M029
dialog: The worst one was in Cannes when your curling iron burnt a hole in my new dressing gown.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F026
dialog: It burned my comb too and all the towels in the bathroom.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M030
dialog: That was a rouser, wasn't it?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F027
dialog: That was the first time you ever hit me.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M031
dialog: I didn't hit you very hard.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F028
dialog: The manager came in and found us rolling around on the floor, biting and scratching like panthers.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M032
dialog: Oh, I'll never forget his face.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F029
dialog: It was ridiculous. Completely ridiculous.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M033
dialog: We were very much younger then.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_F030
dialog: And very much sillier.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_1_M034
dialog: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M000
dialog: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F000
dialog: Honey, you knew there was nothing in that.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M001
dialog: I knew nothing of the sort. You took presents from him.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F001
dialog: Presents? Just a trivial little broach.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M002
dialog: Ah, yes, I remember it well. Bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F002
dialog: No, it wasn't. It was very pretty. I still have it and I wear it often.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M003
dialog: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F003
dialog: No, I didn't. You worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M004
dialog: You must admit, he was in love with you, wasn't he?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F004
dialog: Just a little perhaps, nothing serious.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M005
dialog: You let him kiss you. You said you did.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F005
dialog: Well, what of it?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M006
dialog: What of it?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F006
dialog: It didn't hurt him at all and I enjoyed it.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M007
dialog: Well, what about me?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F007
dialog: Well, if you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey, you never would have known a thing about it.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M008
dialog: Well, that's a nice point of view I must say.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F008
dialog: I'm bored with this conversation.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M009
dialog: Me, too. Bored stiff. You want some brandy?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F009
dialog: No, thanks.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M010
dialog: I think I'll have some.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F010
dialog: Don't see why you want any. You've already had two glasses.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M011
dialog: No particular reason. Anyhow they were very small ones.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F011
dialog: Just seems so silly to go on and on and on with such a thing.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M012
dialog: You can hardly call three liquor glasses in a whole evening going on and on and on.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F012
dialog: Well, it's become a habit with you.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M013
dialog: You needn't be so grand, just because you don't happen to want any yourself at the moment.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F013
dialog: Don't be so stupid.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M014
dialog: Really, Amanda.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F014
dialog: What?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M015
dialog: Nothing.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M016
dialog: Going out somewhere dear?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F015
dialog: No, just making myself fascinating for you.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M017
dialog: That reply has broken my heart.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F016
dialog: A woman's job is to allure the man. Watch me a minute, will you?

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M018
dialog: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F017
dialog: No, it isn't.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M019
dialog: Yes, it is.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F018
dialog: Oh, be quiet.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M020
dialog: Ah, it's a pity you didn't have any more brandy. It might have made you a little less disagreeable.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_F019
dialog: Doesn't seem to have worked such wonders with you.

speaker: Ses02F_script03_2_M021

dialog: How you doing? You know what I forgot? I forgot to bring my flashlight. How - how could I forget to bring my flashlight? How could I be so stupid?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F001
dialog: What flashlight?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M007
dialog: You know the flashlight, the silver one, there is only one, isn't there?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F002
dialog: That's not your flashlight.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M008
dialog: Who's is it?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F003
dialog: It's ours; it's mine too.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M009
dialog: Oh well, sure, yes.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F004
dialog: But you kept saying my flashlight as if somehow it's just yours. I mean how is it supposed to make me feel?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M010
dialog: No. No. Of course our flashlight yours and mine. Mi flashlight, es su flashlight, naturally.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M011
dialog: How could we forget to bring it? I hope the moon stays out.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M012
dialog: I wonder do they always run during a full moon? I can't remember if it was full last year, do you remember?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F005
dialog: Yea.

dialog: You cold, you want my jacket? We should've - we should've brought our blanket, our blanket, how could we forget to bring the blanket?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M014
dialog: Oh, a six-pack, that's, should've brought a -- a six-pack be just the ticket right now. How could I forget,

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M015
dialog: oh man. Like a kid, it's amazing I got out of the house with my fly zipped.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M016
dialog: You think they can hear us talk or feel the vibrations in the sand when we move around?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F006
dialog: I'm cold.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M017
dialog: What you want my jacket?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F007
dialog: It's after eleven. Let's just go home.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M018
dialog: Are you kidding, we'd miss it. We, we just got here. What's the point in coming down here if we just turn around and go home?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F008
dialog: There is no point in coming down here.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M019
dialog: Right.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F009
dialog: That's my point.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M020
dialog: That's my point too.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F010
dialog: So let's go.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M021
dialog: No. No. That's not my point. The point is there is no point in coming down here if we just leave. Don't you want to see it?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F011
dialog: Not particularly.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M022
dialog: Why not?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F012
dialog: I don't, it's just stupid.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M023
dialog: Honey, this is a natural phenomenon. I mean it only happens once a year.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M024
dialog: Think about the people in Kansas, they- they'd have to get a plane ticket and hotel reservations to see this. We live forty minutes away it's too good to pass up.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F013
dialog: Pass up what? These little fish swim onto the beach flop around and swim away, and then they die.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M025
dialog: Yea, but that moment on the beach is the highlight of their little lives. I mean all that flopping is laying eggs or what do you, mating or spotting or something like that.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M026
dialog: This is a big night for these guys, life's last orgy.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F014
dialog: What are you so excited about? I mean it's not a moon landing we're talking about here it's fish. It's a fish nobody even eats.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M027
dialog: Yes they do.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F015
dialog: Augie

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M028
dialog: Okay. But it's fish that do something none of the other fish do. Like the swallows returning to Capistrano, or the Lemmings throwing themselves off the cliffs

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M029
dialog: you know there is like, there is a certain mystery here, a magic, a bit of the unexplainable. I don't see how you cannot be interested.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F016
dialog: I'm just not.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M030
dialog: For real?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F017
dialog: Yes.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M031
dialog: I don't get it. The first time we came here you said it was the best night of your life.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M032
dialog: And then last year I remember specifically you were so excited that you stubbed your toe on the way pushing me out of the house, and you didn't even notice until we got in the car.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F018
dialog: Last year you'll also remember our shoes got wet, I got sand in my panties, you got a sore throat, we got into a big fight over nothing, and we didn't see the Grunions.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M033
dialog: We weren't in a good spot.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F019
dialog: We didn't see them the first time either.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M034
dialog: We just weren't in a good spot; this is a much better spot. I've got good instincts for these things.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M035
dialog: There is that, oh no that's just seaweed, isn't it?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M036
dialog: This is, this is great, isn't it? I wouldn't miss this for anything. Now listen to this, I know you're not interested but just listen.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M037
dialog: Out there somewhere there is this huge mass of silver fish headed this way,

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M038
dialog: they don't why, we don't know why. They didn't take a vote or anything; they didn't get a map or an invitation.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M039
dialog: Just all as one. This little time sensitive firecracker, instinctual firecracker in their body just went off and all as one they turned and formed a line as long the California coast and started swimming. They're swimming right now as if that's the only thing that matters.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M040
dialog: It's single mindedness, with no mind, it's urgency that's pure urge, they don't know what drives them. They don't ask it a name or ask it a question,

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M041
dialog: they just turn as one and start the swim and brings them right here to this spot where we stand, for a massive celebration of sex and death.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M042
dialog: Look at me; I'm giving myself goose bumps all my hairs are popping up.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F020
dialog: That's the wind.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M043
dialog: Well, so what do you think?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F021
dialog: About what?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_M044
dialog: What I was saying.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_1_F022
dialog: It's ridiculous.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M000
dialog: So what do you think?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F000
dialog: About what?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M001
dialog: What I was saying.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F001
dialog: It's ridiculous.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M002
dialog: Certainly it's not. Slightly exaggerated scientific fact.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F002
dialog: It's PR. Someone sold you a bill of goods that this wonderful event is going to take place on the beach.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M003
dialog: Well, I'm not the only one look at all these people.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F003
dialog: Yea, sure everyone was sold the same story. I mean it keeps us all excited, keeps us coming back for more, keeps us thinking that life is going to start any second now if we can just get in on the action and find the right spot.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M004
dialog: Are we talking about the same thing?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F004
dialog: I'm sorry but it's still just fish to me.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M005
dialog: Carla, can I ask you something? Don't take this wrong but are you having your period?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F005
dialog: Goddamn it Augie don't ask me that. I hate it when you ask me that. You always ask me that. It's insulting.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M006
dialog: Well, what's bugging you?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F006
dialog: We just have different ideas of what this evening is supposed to look like.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M007
dialog: There is nothing to it, we come here, the Grunion arrive, then do their little fish business, we go oh ah look, they go home, we go home.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F007
dialog: For heavens sake we are not going to see the Grunions.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M008
dialog: Why not?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F008
dialog: We never do, do we? I mean have we ever?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M009
dialog: We've missed them twice; that's not ever.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F009
dialog: Twice is every time we've tried, that's ever.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M010
dialog: Well, we'll see them this year.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F010
dialog: No we won't; it's pointless. It's like waiting up to see Santa Claus,

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F011
dialog: I mean I feel like my whole life is going to be spent standing on the beach waiting for the fish to show up with my eyes open and my hands clasped expectantly and the fish won't show up.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M011
dialog: I thought you wanted to see them.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F012
dialog: You don't understand anything I'm saying.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M012
dialog: No of course not.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F013
dialog: I did want to see them, I always do. I mean I keep thinking that this is going to be the time and it never is.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M013
dialog: It's just fish, I mean nothing to get traumatized over.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F014
dialog: For heavens sake this isn't about fish.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M014
dialog: All right. I've been trying to work this backwards but I cannot seem to pinpoint the moment that we took a turn for the worst.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M015
dialog: You were fine during the phone call from Marge, dinner was okay, doing the dishes was no problem, let's see, I took a shower, you watched the news, you said

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M016
dialog: "the Grunion are running tonight," I said "great, let's go, I feel lucky,"

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M017
dialog: okay so I'm getting on my jacket and putting out the animals, getting the car out of the garage-

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F015
dialog: Do you remember the first time we came to see it? It was about four years ago right after we got married.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F016
dialog: We thought I was pregnant and we opened a bottle of champagne but no glasses, you asked me to dance, we kicked off our shoes and you popped the cork.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F017
dialog: And when we were dancing you said the softest most intimate things to me right into my ears so I could feel them as much as hear them

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F018
dialog: and I remember thinking that this is it you know. At last, at last I am as happy as I am supposed to be

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M018
dialog: Wait a minute I've got it

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F019
dialog: Just dancing barefoot in the sand, drinking champagne out of the bottle.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M019
dialog: It was in the car, right? Driving past the Knickerbocker Liquor Locker you said, let's get some champagne and I said times are wasting or something like that, right?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M020
dialog: Of course, I see it now; you want this to be like that other time, right? That's it, right?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F020
dialog: I'd rather not remember some things. I would rather not hope for some things.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M021
dialog: Yea. Okay, sure, no. I see. Listen, you want to dance?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F021
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M022
dialog: You want to go get some champagne?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F022
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M023
dialog: Take off our shoes?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F023
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M024
dialog: What, you want me to breathe in your ear?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F024
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M025
dialog: Get married again?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F025
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M026
dialog: What? What? You want a divorce?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F026
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M027
dialog: A vacation?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F027
dialog: No.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M028
dialog: A new carpet? A poodle, a ice cream, backrub, a suicide pact, what, what Carla, what the hell do you want?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F028
dialog: I want something to turn out the way that it supposed to.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M029
dialog: Well welcome to the human race, all right. Do you think this is what I had in mind when I proposed? You think I had this great fantasy going that four years down the road we'd come to the beach and yell at each other over fish?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M030
dialog: You think I knew that there be times when you'd look at me like I'm a used Kleenex, or that I'd look at you and think holy hell when is the next flight to Alaska?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M031
dialog: No, no, just like you I thought it was going to be all like peaches and roses and sand in our toes, and wind in our hair, and the fish will always come and the bills will pay themselves and we'll have three, fat, rosy kids and ha-ha baby the joke is on us

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M032
dialog: 'cause you know what you get Carla, you know what you get? This.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F029
dialog: This? What, what is this? This isn't even anything.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M033
dialog: Yes, it is.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F030
dialog: I'm sure, this is standing on the beach, this is waiting, this is fighting.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M034
dialog: Right.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F031
dialog: Well, but this isn't anything like I thought anything would be like.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M035
dialog: No, I know. Me neither.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F032
dialog: I mean it's -- this is just this. I mean it includes a lot and everything but isn't something else. Do you have any idea what I'm trying to say?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M036
dialog: I'm doing the best I can.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F033
dialog: I know that Augie. Really I do.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F034
dialog: I know that you meant this to be special and nice, and there's the sand and the moon and everything but I just couldn't help thinking about being somewhere else.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M037
dialog: Maybe if you were with somebody else too.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F035
dialog: I didn't say that.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M038
dialog: No, I know. But still, I know I don't make you happy.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F036
dialog: For heavens sake, whatever I'm doing I'd rather be doing it with you.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M039
dialog: Yeah?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F037
dialog: Don't be ridiculous. I mean don't you know that?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F038
dialog: You're the one who probably wishes he was with someone else, someone who knew how to enjoy herself and didn't take everything so hard.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M040
dialog: Now that you mention it. No, I don't.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F039
dialog: Okay. Fine, so we're in the wrong spot but we're with the right person.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M041
dialog: I don't know it seemed like a pretty good spot to me. Look at the moon - view the moon view I got from here.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F040
dialog: Yes, I noticed that. It looks pretty on the water doesn't it? Big old white moon.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M042
dialog: What have we got here?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F041
dialog: Augie, you brought refreshments.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M043
dialog: It's not champagne.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F042
dialog: Well, I guess we don't need glasses.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M044
dialog: You still cold? Do you want my jacket? Do you want to go home?

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F043
dialog: No. No. I think you might be right. I think this may be the spot after all.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F044
dialog: Augie, I'm sorry.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M045
dialog: Shh, if we're very quiet the fish might come.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F045
dialog: Or not.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_M046
dialog: Or not.

speaker: Ses02M_script02_2_F046
dialog: Hmm.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M000
dialog: Good God.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F000
dialog: Do you think it's them?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M001
dialog: I wonder.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F001
dialog: Well, nobody knows we're here except Freda and she wouldn't ring up.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M002
dialog: Must be them then.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F002
dialog: What are we going to do?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M003
dialog: We're all right darling, aren't we whatever happens?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F003
dialog: Now and always sweet.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M004
dialog: I don't care then.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F004
dialog: It's bound to come sooner or later.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M005
dialog: Hello? Hello? What? Wrong number.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F005
dialog: Oh. It sends shivers down my spine.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M006
dialog: What do we do if they suddenly walk in on us?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F006
dialog: Behave exquisitely.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M007
dialog: With the most perfect poise.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F007
dialog: Yes, I should probably to a court curtsey.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M008
dialog: Things that ought to matter dreadfully don't matter at all when one's is happy, do they?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F008
dialog: What's so horrible is that one can't stay happy.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M009
dialog: Oh darling don't say that.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F009
dialog: It's true; the whole business is a very poor joke.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M010
dialog: Meaning that sacred and beautiful thing love?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F010
dialog: Yes. Meaning just that.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M011
dialog: What does it all mean that's what I ask- that's what I ask myself in my ceaseless quest for ultimate truth? Good God what does it all mean?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F011
dialog: Don't laugh at me. I'm serious.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M012
dialog: You mustn't be serious my dear one, that's just what they want.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F012
dialog: Who's they?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M013
dialog: All those futile moralists, who try to make life unbearable, laugh at them, be flippant. Laugh at everything all their sacred shibboleths

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M014
dialog: flippancy brings out the acid in their damned sweetness in light.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F013
dialog: Well, if I laugh at everything then I must laugh at us too.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M015
dialog: Certainly you must, we figures of fun all right.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F014
dialog: Well, shall we always want to bicker and fight?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M016
dialog: No, that desire will fade along with our passion.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F015
dialog: Oh dear, should we like that?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M017
dialog: Depends on how well we play it.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F016
dialog: Well, what happens if one of us dies, does the one that's left still laugh?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M018
dialog: Yes, yes, with all his might.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F017
dialog: Well that's serious enough, isn't it?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M019
dialog: No, no it isn't, death is very laughable, such a cunning little mystery, all done with mirrors.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F018
dialog: Darling, I believe you're talking nonsense.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M020
dialog: So is everyone else in the long run.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M021
dialog: Let's be superficial and pity the poor philosophers, let's blow our trumpets and squeakers and enjoy the party as much as we can. Like quite idiotic, very small, school children. Let's savor the delight of the moment.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M022
dialog: Come kiss me darling before your body rots and worms pop in and out of your eye sockets.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F019
dialog: Elliot, worms don't pop.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M023
dialog: I don't care what you do see. You can paint yourself green and dance naked in the Place Vendome, and rush off madly with all the men in the world and I shan't say a word, as long as you love me best.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F020
dialog: Thank you dear, the same applies you, except that if I catch you so much as looking at another woman, I'll kill you.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M024
dialog: You remember that awful scene we had in Venice?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F021
dialog: Which particular one?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M025
dialog: The one when you bought that little, painted, wooden snake in the Piazza and put it on my bed.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F022
dialog: Oh Charles, that was his name Charles. It did wiggle so beautifully.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M026
dialog: Horrible thing, I hated it.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F023
dialog: I know you did. You threw it out of the window into the Grand Canal; I don't think I'll ever forgive you for that.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M027
dialog: How long did that row last?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F024
dialog: It went on intermittently for days.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M028
dialog: The worst one was in Cannes when your curling iron burned a hole in my new dressing gown.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F025
dialog: It burned my comb too and all the towels in the bathroom.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M029
dialog: That was a rouser, wasn't it?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F026
dialog: That was the first time you ever hit me.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M030
dialog: I didn't hit you very hard.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F027
dialog: The manager came in and found us rolling around on the floor biting and scratching like panthers.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M031
dialog: I'll never forget his face.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F028
dialog: Oh it was ridiculous, completely ridiculous.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M032
dialog: We were very much younger then.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_F029
dialog: And very much sillier.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_1_M033
dialog: As a matter of fact the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M000
dialog: As a matter of fact, the real cause of that row was Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F000
dialog: You knew there was nothing in that.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M001
dialog: I knew nothing of the sort. You took presents from him.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F001
dialog: Presents, just a trivial little broach.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M002
dialog: Yes, I remember it well, bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F002
dialog: No it wasn't. It was very pretty I still have it and I wear it often.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M003
dialog: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F003
dialog: No I didn't, you worked the whole thing up in your jealous imagination.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M004
dialog: You must admit he was in love with you, wasn't he?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F004
dialog: Just a little perhaps, nothing serious.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M005
dialog: You let him kiss you; you said you did.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F005
dialog: What of it?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M006
dialog: What of it?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F006
dialog: It gave him a lot of pleasure, it didn't hurt me any.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M007
dialog: What about me?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F007
dialog: Well, if you hadn't been so nosey and suspicious you never wouldn't have known anything about it.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M008
dialog: That's a nice point of view I must say.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F008
dialog: I'm bored of this conversation.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M009
dialog: Yes, me too, bored stiff. You want some Brandy?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F009
dialog: No thanks.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M010
dialog: I have a little I think.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F010
dialog: I don't see why you want any you've already had two glasses.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M011
dialog: No particular reason. Anyhow, they are very small ones.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F011
dialog: It just seems so silly to go on and on and on with such a thing.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M012
dialog: You can hardly call three liquor glasses in a whole evening going on and on and on.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F012
dialog: Well, it's become a habit with you.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M013
dialog: You needn't be so grand just because don't happen want any yourself right now.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F013
dialog: Don't be so stupid.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M014
dialog: Really, Amanda.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F014
dialog: What?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M015
dialog: Nothing.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F015
dialog: No I'm just making myself fascinating for you.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M016
dialog: Going out somewhere, dear?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F016
dialog: It's a woman's job to allure the man

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M017
dialog: That reply has broken my heart.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F017
dialog: watch me a minute, will you?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M018
dialog: As a matter of fact, that's perfectly true.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F018
dialog: Oh, no it isn't.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M019
dialog: Yes it is.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F019
dialog: Be quiet.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M020
dialog: It's a pity you didn't have any more Brandy it might have made you a little less disagreeable.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F020
dialog: It doesn't seem to work such wonders with you.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M021
dialog: Snap, snap, snap, like a little adder.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F021
dialog: Adders don't snap they sting.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M022
dialog: Oh nonsense they have a little bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F022
dialog: They sting.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M023
dialog: They snap.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F023
dialog: I don't care. Do you understand? I don't care. I don't care if they bark or roll about like hoops.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M024
dialog: Tell me, did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F024
dialog: Yes, I did quite a lot.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M025
dialog: I imagine you let him kiss you good deal more then.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F025
dialog: Mind your own business.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M026
dialog: What riotous time you must have had.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M027
dialog: No restraint at all, very enjoyable, never had much anyhow.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F026
dialog: You're quite insufferable. I expect it's because you're drunk.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M028
dialog: I am not in the least drunk.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M029
dialog: I imagine, as I may have already mentioned, I've had three minute liquor glasses of Brandy the whole evening long a child of two couldn't get drunk on that.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F027
dialog: On the contrary a child of two could get violently drunk on only one glass of Brandy.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M030
dialog: Oh very interesting. How about a child of four, a child of six or a child of nine?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F028
dialog: Oh be quiet.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M031
dialog: We can get a good little debate going about that, don't you think? Intemperate tots.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F029
dialog: Not very funny my dear, you better have some more Brandy.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M032
dialog: All right. I will.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M033
dialog: Better turn that off I think.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F030
dialog: Why?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M034
dialog: Because it's late and it'll annoy the people upstairs.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F031
dialog: There aren't any people upstairs it's a photographer's studio.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M035
dialog: There are people downstairs I suppose?

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F032
dialog: They're away in Tunis.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M036
dialog: This is no time of the year for Tunis.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F033
dialog: Turn it on again, please.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M037
dialog: I'll do no such thing.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F034
dialog: Very well, if you insist on being boorish and idiotic.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M038
dialog: Turn it off it's driving me mad.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F035
dialog: You are far too temperamental. Try to control yourself.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M039
dialog: Turn it off.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F036
dialog: Stop it. Stop it. I hate you.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M040
dialog: Amanda, listen. Listen.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F037
dialog: Listen indeed. I'm sick and tired of listening to you, damn sadistic bully.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M041
dialog: Very amusing indeed.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F038
dialog: Stop it. Stop it. I hate you, do you hear? You're overbearing and conceited and utterly impossible.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M042
dialog: You're a vile tempered, loose living, wicked little beast and I hope I never see you again as long as I live.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F039
dialog: This is the end, do you hear? The end finally and forever.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M043
dialog: You're not going like this.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F040
dialog: Oh yes I am.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M044
dialog: You're not.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F041
dialog: Yes, I am. Let go of me you're cruel fiend and I hate and loathe you. Thank God I realized who you really are before I would ever, ever marry you again. I would never marry you again. I'd rather die in torment.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M045
dialog: Shut up.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M046
dialog: Shut up.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_M047
dialog: I wouldn't marry you again if you came to me on your bended knees. You're a evil minded little vampire. I hope to God I never see you again as long as I live.

speaker: Ses02M_script03_2_F042
dialog: You're a beast. I hate you. Stop it. Stop it.
